Quotes: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: It's a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He says "I was beaten," he does not say "My men were beaten".
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

Quotes: Wit is educated insolence.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Where sense is wanting, everything is wanting.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The finite is annihilated in the presence of the infinite, and becomes a pure nothing. So our spirit before God, so our justice before divine justice.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Do you wish people to think well of you? Don't speak well of yourself.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: The harvest of old age is the recollection and abundance of blessing previously secured.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Today different ethnic groups and different nations come together due to common sense.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: Our sins are more easily remembered than our good deeds.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: A nose that can see is worth two that sniff.
Author: Eugene Ionesco

Quotes: We often pardon those that annoy us, but we cannot pardon those we annoy.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: If it were not for the company of fools, a witty man would often be greatly at a loss.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: There is nothing besides a spiritual world;what we call the world of the senses is the Evil in the spiritual world, and what we call Evil is only the necessity of a moment in our eternal evolution.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: Wit is the epitaph of an emotion.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Whenever I climb I am followed by a dog called 'Ego'.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: A man never tells you anything until you contradict him.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving!
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: I have had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Men die in despair, while spirits die in ecstasy.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: By a lie, a man... annihilates his dignity as a man.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quotes: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies, but not the madness of people.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: The Cardinal is at his wit's end - it is true that he had not far to go.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Fame is the thirst of youth.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Service which is rendered without joy helps neither the servant nor the served. But all other pleasures and possessions pale into nothingness before service which is rendered in a spirit of joy.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: I was taught that the way of progress was neither swift nor easy.
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I have the fault of being a little more sincere than is proper.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: People don't mind being mean;but they never want to be ridiculous.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: A gentleman is one who never hurts anyone's feelings unintentionally.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: I always pass on good advice. It is the only thing to do with it. It is never of any use to oneself.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: This City is what it is because our citizens are what they are.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Your silence gives consent.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Honesty is for the most part less profitable than dishonesty.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The spirit of resistance to government is so valuable on certain occasions that I wish it to be always kept alive.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Puns are the droppings of soaring wits.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Common sense is in spite of, not as the result of education.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Never argue at the dinner table, for the one who is not hungry always gets the best of the argument.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: By appreciation, we make excellence in others our own property.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: A witty saying proves nothing.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: We are not trying to entertain the critics. I'll take my chances with the public.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: But men are men;the best sometimes forget.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Give every man thy ear, but few thy voice.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: There's many a man has more hair than wit.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: He is winding the watch of his wit;by and by it will strike.
Author: William Shakespeare
